intro: Chrysomelea lanceolata, commonly known as the lanceolate chrysomelea, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, fragrant flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
